original: Ehn, Erik Wilhelm, bergsingenjör, Göteborg, f. 25/4/90 i Töftedal, Älvsb. 1., av tullförv. Oscar Samuel E. o. Anna Nordqvist. G. 26 m. Martha Butler. Barn: Erik Butkr f. 28, Charles Lennart 30, Marianne 36. — Studrex. i Nyköp. 08, avg:ex. fr. KTH 14, dipl. fr. HH 19. Förest, f. lab. v. kulla-gerfabr. h. Grönkvists Mek. Verkst. A-B i Katrineholm 13-15, f. lab. v. Nya A-B Atlas i Sthlm 15-16, driftsing. v. A-B Pumpseparators gjut. i Katrineh. 16-17, tekn. diriassist. v. Skand. Kul-lagerfabr. A-B 17-18, anst. v. Delco Light Products Corp. i Dayton, Ohio, 19-20, v. The Timken Roller Bearing Co. i Canton, Ohio, 20-24, (chefmetal-lurg 23), v. Nord. Kullag. A-B i Gbg 24-25, v. A-B Sv. kullagerfabr. i Gbg 25-28, v. SKF-Norma AG i Canstatt-Stuttgart, Tyskl., 28-30, v. Verein. Kugellagerfabr. AG i Schweinfurt 30- 46, v. SKF i Gbg sed. 46. Medl. av Sv. Teikn ."fören. is^d. 14.
translated: Ehn, Erik Wilhelm, mining engineer, Gothenburg, born on April 25th, 1890 in Töftedal, Älvsborg County, first child of customs officer Oscar Samuel E. and Anna Nordqvist. Married on December 26th, with Martha Butler. Children: Erik Butler, born in 1928, Charles Lennart, born in 1930, Marianne, born in 1936. He studied in Nyköping in 1908, graduated from the Royal Institute of Technology in 1914, and earned a diploma from the Stockholm School of Economics in 1919. He worked as a laboratory supervisor at Grönkvists Mek. Verkst. A-B in Katrineholm from 1913 to 1915, as a laboratory supervisor at Nya A-B Atlas in Stockholm from 1915 to 1916, as a production engineer at A-B Pumpseparators gjut. in Katrineholm from 1916 to 1917, as a technical director's assistant at Skand. Kul-lagerfabr. A-B from 1917 to 1918, as an employee at Delco Light Products Corp. in Dayton, Ohio, from 1919 to 1920, at The Timken Roller Bearing Co. in Canton, Ohio, from 1920 to 1924 (Chief Metallurgist in 1923), at Nord. Kullag. A-B in Gothenburg from 1924 to 1925, at A-B Sv. kullagerfabr. in Gothenburg from 1925 to 1928, at SKF-Norma AG in Canstatt-Stuttgart, Germany, from 1928 to 1930, at Verein. Kugellagerfabr. AG in Schweinfurt from 1930 to 1946, and at SKF in Gothenburg since 1946. He was a member of the Swedish Engineering Association since 1914.
